title: ZOE FOR PRESIDENT
description: Front-end development (HTML/CSS/JS) using Ampersand and CSS/JS animation. The Javascript was written in ES2015 using Babel and Gulp.

title: TOYOTA MIRAI
description: Front-end development (HTML/CSS/JS) on some of the Fueled by Everything pages and the News page. This involved animations using GSAP, D3, Canvas and CSS.

title: DROGA5.com
description: Front-end development (HTML/CSS/JS) and PHP (Wordpress) on site updates.

title: CHOBANI.com
description: Lead Front-end developer (HTML/CSS/JS) using Backbone and CSS/JS animation.

title: ADVERTISING ARCHIVE
description: Front-end development on global search and backstory pages using the Google Closure library.

title: SIX SECOND SAFETY
description: Front-end development on site additions and maintenance.

title: PROJECT IMAGINAT10N
description: Front-end development on site additions and maintenance.

title: MDC-PARTNERS.com
description: Front-end development using Google Maps API and JS animations.

title: MDC-PARTNERS.com MOBILE
description: Front-end (HTML/CSS/JS) and back-end (PHP) development. I was responsible for building out the mobile version of the relaunched MDC Partners site for 2013. I used the Laravel PHP framework to pull from the services that the desktop site shared with the mobile site on the back-end. jQuery and Backbone were used on the front-end.

title: GOBBLEPALOOZA
description: HTML/CSS/Javascript development. This site used tabular sorting through Backbone and parallax scroll animations in javascript.

title: OPEN FORUM
description: Did ongoing maintenance through HTML/CSS/JS/.Net MVC development starting in 2009, and eventually was part of a complete rebuild of the site in 2011.

title: NEXTPEDITION
description: HTML/CSS/Javascript development. Raphael.js was used for the landing page animations.

title: SUPER SEARCH
description: A Flash/Actionscript 3 microsite that let the user customize their own Supermodelquin and share an image of it.

title: THE MOST EPIC NIGHT EVER
description: Flash/Actionscript 3 development on a Times Square billboard.

title: BK.com
description: Front-end (HTML/CSS/JS) development of the menu and nutrition page, which included a burger builder to let the user create any meal they wanted. This site won an FWA Site of the Day on Aug 12, 2009.

title: VW.com
description: HTML/CSS/Javascript development for the certified pre-owned section of vw.com.

title: HERO FACTORY
description: Flash/Actionscript 3 development on a microsite built as an invitation to employees for a superhero themed holiday party. It let you customize and share your own comic book cover.

title: WHOPPER VIRGINS
description: Flash microsite counting down to the start of the Burger King Whopper Virgins campaign, developed and animated in Actionscript 3.
